OVERVIEW: The Morado series consists of moderately deep, well drained, moderately permeable soils on summits and side slopes of hills and mountains of the Humid Mountains and Valleys MLRA.  They formed in residuum that weathered from basalt flow and tuff.  Near the type location, the mean annual temperature is about 77 degrees F., and the mean annual precipitation is about 57 inches.  Slopes range from 12 to 60 percent.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, mixed, superactive, isohyperthermic Dystric Eutrudepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Morado clay loam--pigeon peas. (Colors are for moist soil)
Ap--0 to 7 inches; dark reddish gray (10R 4/1) clay loam; weak fine subangular blocky structure; friable; slightly sticky, moderately plastic; common fine roots; neutral; clear smooth boundary. (4 to 7 inches thick)
Bw--7 to 17 inches; reddish gray (5YR 5/2) clay loam; weak fine subangular blocky structure breaking to weak fine granular; friable; slightly sticky, moderately plastic; common fine roots; few fine faint weak red (2.5YR 4/2), yellowish red (5YR 4/6), and reddish brown (5YR 4/3) masses and splotches; the colors are from weathered parent material and are not redoximorphic features; slightly acid; gradual wavy boundary. (6 to 11 inches thick)
BC--17 to 24 inches; 34 percent brown (7.5YR 4/2), 33 percent dark reddish gray (5YR 4/2), and 33 percent dark gray (5YR 4/1) clay loam in a variegated pattern; weak fine subangular blocky structure; friable; slightly sticky, moderately plastic; few fine roots; the colors are from weathered parent material and are not redoximorphic features; slightly acid; clear wavy boundary. (0 to 12 inches thick)
C--24 to 33 inches; 34 percent brown (7.5YR 4/2), 33 percent dark reddish gray (5YR 4/2), and 33 percent gray (5YR 5/1) loam in a variegated pattern; massive; friable; slightly sticky, slightly plastic; the colors are from weathered parent material and are not redoximorphic features; slightly acid; clear wavy boundary. (8 to 16 inches thick)
R--33+ inches; reddish gray (5YR 5/2) semi-consolidated volcanic rock.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Anasco, Puerto Rico.  Approximately 2.7 miles southeast from Josefa community from the intersection of P.R. Hwy. 109 and P.R. Hwy. 406, about 3.3 miles southeast on P.R. Hwy. 406, about 3,000 feet northeast from P.R. Hwy. 406, and about 600 feet southeast from paved road in a field of pigeon peas.  USGS Central La Plata topographic quadrangle (1964); lat. 18 degrees 16 minutes 29 seconds N.; long. 67 degrees 04 minutes 28 seconds W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: Solum thickness range from 10 to 30 inches.  Depth to the semi-consolidated volcanic rock range from 20 to 40 inches.  Reaction ranges from moderately acid to neutral throughout.
The A or Ap horizon has hue of 10R to 7.5YR, value of 3 to 6, and chroma of 1 or 2.  Content of parapebbles is less than 5 percent, by volume.  Texture is clay loam or clay.
The Bw horizon has hue of 2.5YR to 7.5YR, value of 3 to 5, and chroma of 1 to 6.  Masses and splotches in shades of yellow, red, and brown range from none to common.  These colors are derived from the parent material and are not indicative of wetness.  Content of parapebbles ranges from 0 to 25 percent, by volume.  Texture is clay loam or clay.
The BC horizon, where present, has hue of 5YR or 7.5YR, value of 3 or 4, and chroma 1 or 2; or has no dominant color and is multicolored in shades of red, brown, yellow and gray.  These colors are derived from the parent material and are not indicative of wetness.  Content of parapebbles ranges from 0 to 15 percent, by volume.  Texture is silty clay loam or clay loam.
The C horizon, where present, has no dominant color and is multicolored in shades of red, brown, yellow and gray.  Original rock structure is visible and weathered rock fragments can be easily broken between fingers. Low chroma mottles appear to have been inherited from the parent material and are not thought to due to wetness.  Content of parapebbles ranges from 0 to 15 percent, by volume.  Texture is loam or silty clay loam.
The Cr horizon, where present, is composed of highly fractured and moderately weathered volcanic rock. It can be excavated with difficulty with hand tools, and is rippable by mechanical equipment.
The R horizon is composed of hard, semi-consolidated volcanic rock.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  There are no known series in the same family.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Morado soils are on summits and side slopes of hills and mountains on Humid Mountains and Valley MLRA.  They formed in residuum that weathered from basalt flow and tuff.  Slopes range from 12 to 60 percent.  The average annual temperature ranges from 75 to 79 degrees F., and the average annual precipitation ranges from 43 to 73 inches.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These include the Caguabo, Maraguez, Mucara and Quebrada series.  All this soils are on similar positions.  In addition, Caguabo soils are shallow to bedrock, Maraguez and Quebrada soils are very deep, and Mucara soils have fine-loamy control sections.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; moderate permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Most areas of Morado soils are on naturalized pastureland. Some small areas used for pigeon peas plantation.  The vegetation consists of native and introduced grasses, shrubs, and trees.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Summits and side slopes of hills and mountains of the Humid Mountains and Valleys MLRA.  The series is of moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE:  Raleigh, North Carolina.

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Ponce Soil Survey Area, Puerto Rico; 1971.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  The 2014 update changes the particle size class back to fine-loamy from fine.  Data indicates it should never have been fine.
Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon:
Ochric epipedon - the zone from 0 to 7 inches (Ap horizon).
Cambic horizon - the zone from 7 to 17 inches (Bw horizon).
Lithic contact - 33 inches.
ADDITIONAL DATA:  Characterization data - pedon No. S61PR011003; sample by NSSL, Lincoln NE.
Morado soils are in MLRA 270.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.

(6 to 11 inches thick)

(0 to 12 inches thick)
